info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 7:48PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Chester, southwestern York, southeastern Spartanburg, southeastern Cherokee and Union Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 748 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles west of Union, or near Buffalo, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Union, Pacolet, Monarch Mill, Buffalo, Jonesville, Lockhart, Sharon, Carlisle, Croft State Park and Rose Hill State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
